post_text: Due to recent experiences of COVID and other events beyond our control, Riverdale C.U.S.D. #100 will be delaying the start of the school year. Teachers will report on Aug. 31st for a week of training. Students will begin their instruction on Sept. 8th. for both remote and in-person instruction. A new school calendar will be posted to the website once it has been amended.
shared_text:
RIVERDALESCHOOLS.ORG
Start of School Delayed Until September 8th ‚Äî Riverdale School District
text:
Due to recent experiences of COVID and other events beyond our control, Riverdale C.U.S.D. #100 will be delaying the start of the school year. Teachers will report on Aug. 31st for a week of training. Students will begin their instruction on Sept. 8th. for both remote and in-person instruction. A new school calendar will be posted to the website once it has been amended.

RIVERDALESCHOOLS.ORG
Start of School Delayed Until September 8th ‚Äî Riverdale School District

post_text:
Good morning! Here are a few updates from projects at the elementary. We are excited to see updates to our bathrooms, water fountains, and entrances.

Also, roofers are working away this weekend on replacing a large section of our old roof. It is great to see these improvements come together and we can‚Äôt wait for students and families to see them!
text:
Good morning! Here are a few updates from projects at the elementary. We are excited to see updates to our bathrooms, water fountains, and entrances.

Also, roofers are working away this weekend on replacing a large section of our old roof. It is great to see these improvements come together and we can‚Äôt wait for students and families to see them!

post_text:
Good morning! A huge thank you goes out to our FBG services team! They have taken on countless projects this summer and are working to put the finishing touches on many of them.

We are grateful for your hard work and efforts to get us ready for back to school while also developing and implementing plans to keep our school clean and safe.

post_text:
While students have been away, we‚Äôve had a number of projects going on that I hope to share with families in the coming weeks. One project we are very proud of is the addition of murals to our building.

A huge thank you goes out to our amazing artist Laura Arnold and to everyone who helped make it come to life including: Lisa Peterson, Cindy Fisher-Oppenheimer, Courtney Luedtke-Bacon, Jamie Fritch, FBG services, and the PTO!

post_text:
Good Morning! Riverdale families, we have a number of old desks and chairs that are no longer needed in our classrooms. Some are still in decent shape and we would love it if they found a good home.

If you would like to set up a learning space for your child at home please feel free to swing by the elementary and help yourself!

post_text:
I have attached a video sharing updates on remote learning and returning student materials. The schedule for returning student materials is included as well. Click on the link below to watch the video.

https://youtu.be/MlhptDOJacM

Student material pick-up schedule:

All times Monday - Friday : 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM and 3:00 PM-5:00 PM

Saturday 10:00 AM-12:00 PM

Days have been designated by grade as follows:

Monday May 18th: 5th grade

Tuesday May 19th and Wednesday 20th: Pre-k, 1st, 3rd

Thursday May 21st and Friday 22nd: K, 2nd 4th

Saturday May 23rd: All grades

*If you students in multiple grades you can pick it all up on the same day

post_text:
Parents and students! Show us how you are learning from home during this time of social distancing. Post a photo or a video and tag one of the schools by typing @riverdale in your post then select one or all of the schools. Also use the hashtag #remoterams and share this post so more see it. We want to recognize everyone's hard work during this trying time! We will be sharing them on our Facebook page and school district website.

#remoterams
Riverdale Elementary School
Riverdale Middle School
Riverdale High School, Port Byron, Illinois

post_text: Chromebooks will be distributed at both the middle/elementary schools this Friday, April 3rd (9-11 am or 1-3 pm) or Saturday morning, April 4th, from 8 am-12 noon. If you already have a device you can use at home, you do not need to come to school and pick up a device. We ask all parents to pull up to the main entrance of the building and remain in their cars- your chromebook/charger will be distributed to you, curbside, along with a letter explaining expectations for usage of the device.
text: Chromebooks will be distributed at both the middle/elementary schools this Friday, April 3rd (9-11 am or 1-3 pm) or Saturday morning, April 4th, from 8 am-12 noon. If you already have a device you can use at home, you do not need to come to school and pick up a device. We ask all parents to pull up to the main entrance of the building and remain in their cars- your chromebook/charger will be distributed to you, curbside, along with a letter explaining expectations for usage of the device.

post_text: The Riverdale School District is proud to announce that our HS Girls Basketball team has advanced to the State Tournament, and will be playing in Bloomington, Illinois this Friday at 5:30 p.m. at Redbird Arena. In an effort to allow our fans the time needed to travel safely to Bloomington, we will be dismissing students 2 hours early this Friday, February 28, 2020. There will be NO afternoon Pre-K on that day. Thanks for your understanding. Good Luck Rams!

post_text: Riverdale PTO is hosting Donuts with Dad tomorrow at the elementary for grades K-2 from 7:15-7:50. Dads and students in grades 3-5 will be hosted on Friday from 7:15-7:50. We are looking forward to seeing everyone there. Students are welcome to hang their bags and jackets up outside of their rooms and then head to the cafeteria. Teachers will be available to receive students in their rooms no sooner than 7:35. Thank you to the PTO and to our Dads for your support!

Teachers will be available to receive students in their rooms no sooner than 7:35. Thank you to the PTO and to our Dads for your support!

post_text:
Kindness Week January 13-17th, 2020

Next week we will celebrate the new year and the new decade with our annual Kindness Week at Riverdale Elementary! We resolve to build our Friendship and Respect Skills!



Students are encouraged to wear the following colors to celebrate character traits that we want to recognize in our school.

Monday the 13th Green for Kindness: Be kind to nature and our world!

Tuesday the 14th Blue for Friendship: If you think that someone can use a friend, be a friend.

Wednesday the 15th Red for Generosity: Be generous with our smiles and kind words and actions towards others!

Thursday the 16th Rainbow of Colors for Courage: Wear you what you like, be proud of yourself and be kind to yourself!

Friday the 17th Black and Gold for Gratitude: Be thankful for our school friends and family and all the learning opportunities at Riverdale Elementary!

*Friday morning students and staff will attend a school wide assembly called The NED‚Äôs Mindset Mission! This will be an experience that teaches us new ways to face challenges!*
text:

Next week we will celebrate the new year and the new decade with our annual Kindness Week at Riverdale Elementary! We resolve to build our Friendship and Respect Skills!



Students are encouraged to wear the following colors to celebrate character traits that we want to recognize in our school.

Monday the 13th Green for Kindness: Be kind to nature and our world!

Tuesday the 14th Blue for Friendship: If you think that someone can use a friend, be a friend.

Wednesday the 15th Red for Generosity: Be generous with our smiles and kind words and actions towards others!

Thursday the 16th Rainbow of Colors for Courage: Wear you what you like, be proud of yourself and be kind to yourself!

Friday the 17th Black and Gold for Gratitude: Be thankful for our school friends and family and all the learning opportunities at Riverdale Elementary!

*Friday morning students and staff will attend a school wide assembly called The NED‚Äôs Mindset Mission! This will be an experience that teaches us new ways to face challenges!*

post_text: Our friend Scarlett Sloan raised $175 by creating bracelets that she sold at the farmers market over the last few months. She wanted to donate it to a good cause. Her charitable donations will be used to help pay for snack milk balances at the elementary. Thank you Scarlett! We are very thankful for your generosity and caring spirit. What a great example and role model for her peers.
